acknowledgments.summary: Joachim Kerschbaumer reported this vulnerability to Johnson Controls, Inc.

notes.title: Legal Notice

notes.text: Successful exploitation of this vulnerability could allow a remote unauthenticated attacker to delete arbitrary files on the system or render the system unusable through a denial-of-service attack.
notes.title: Risk evaluation

notes.text: CISA recommends users take defensive measures to minimize the risk of exploitation of this vulnerability. Specifically, users should:
notes.title: Recommended Practices

notes.text:
CISA reminds organizations to perform proper impact analysis and risk assessment prior to deploying defensive measures.
CISA also provides a section for control systems security recommended practices on the ICS webpage on us-cert.gov. Several recommended practices are available for reading and download, including Improving Industrial Control Systems Cybersecurity with Defense-in-Depth Strategies.
notes.title: Recommended Practices

notes.text: Organizations observing any suspected malicious activity should follow their established internal procedures and report their findings to CISA for tracking and correlation against other incidents.
notes.title: Recommended Practices

references.summary: ICS Advisory ICSA-20-282-01 - Web Scraped Version

document.title: Johnson Controls Sensormatic Electronics American Dynamics victor Web Client and Software House C•CURE Web Client (Update A)

product.name: Software House C•CURE Web Client - - and  including 2.80
American Dynamics victor Web Client - - and  including 5.4.1

branches.name: Sensormatic Electronics, LLC, a subsidiary of Johnson Controls

notes.text: American Dynamics victor Web Client does not perform an authorization check when an attacker with access from an adjacent network attempts to delete arbitrary files on the system. CVE-2020-9048 has been assigned to this vulnerability. A CVSS v3 base score of 7.1 has been calculated; the CVSS vector string is (AV:A/AC:L/PR:N/UI:N/S:U/C:N/I:H/A:L).
notes.title: Vulnerability Summary

remediations.details: Johnson Controls recommends users upgrade all versions of victor Web Client to v5.6. Registered users can download the update.
Registered users can obtain the software update by downloading the update.
For more detailed mitigation instructions, please see Johnson Controls Product Security Advisory JCI-PSA-2020-09
Further ICS security notices and product security guidance are located at the Johnson Controls product security website.

Additional mitigation guidance and recommended practices are publicly available on the ICS webpage on us-cert.gov in the Technical Information Paper, ICS-TIP-12-146-01B--Targeted Cyber Intrusion Detection and Mitigation Strategies.
